intro: Sarcoyucca schottii, commonly known as the Schott's yucca, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in coastal or dry forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
